title: Mossad hired IRGC security agents to plant explosives that killed Haniyeh report
message:
Mossad hired IRGC security agents to plant explosives that killed Haniyeh — reportTimes of Israel ^ | 8/3/24 | TOI StaffPosted on by Uncle MiltieThe Mossad enlisted Iranian security agents to plant explosives in the Tehran guesthouse where Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh was staying, according to a report in the Telegraph.
by 3 posted onby Uncle Miltie (And yet we have the morally inverted allahu akhbar chorus at FR on the pro-barbarism side!)
by 9 posted onby Uncle Miltie (And yet we have the morally inverted allahu akhbar chorus at FR on the pro-barbarism side!)
It contradicted earlier reports, including by the IRGC’s Tasnim news agency, that a missile had killed Haniyeh.
by 12 posted onby Uncle Miltie (And yet we have the morally inverted allahu akhbar chorus at FR on the pro-barbarism side!)

title: Mourners bury Hamas chief in Qatar as more escalation looms over Middle East
message:
Haniyeh had lived in Qatar, along with other senior members of Hamas’ political leadership.
Hamas said Haniyeh was killed in a strike on a guesthouse in Tehran where he was staying after the swearing-in ceremony of the new Iranian president.
Khaled Kaddoumi, Hamas’ representative in Iran, was staying on a lower floor.
Kaddoumi saw Haniyeh face down on the floor and spotted the body of Haniyeh’s bodyguard, holding a bloody Quran.
On Thursday, Israel announced that it had killed the shadowy leader of Hamas’ military wing, Mohammed Deif, in a July airstrike.

title: Iran Is Expected to Attack Israel In Matter of Days
message:
The Biden Administration is preparing for Iran to attack Israel in a matter of days as tensions heighten after the assassination of Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran earlier this week.
AdvertisementThree U.S. officials told Axios that the White House is preparing to counteract a potential Iranian attack on Israel after reports stated the terrorist country will launch a wide-ranging missile attack on Israel.
The ambush will likely be in accordance with Iran’s April 13 attack on Israel but warned it would be more extensive and far deadlier.
Several other pro-Iranian groups, such as Shia militias in Iraq and the Houthis in Yemen, are also expected to launch an attack on Israel.
According to the Pentagon, U.S. Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin will direct “multiple force posture moves” in the Middle East ahead of a potential attack.

title: US sends more fighter jets and ships to Middle East ahead of possible Iranian retaliation
message:
US sends more fighter jets and ships to Middle East ahead of possible Iranian retaliationThe Pentagon will send an additional fighter squadron and more warships to the Middle East to help defend Israel should Iran react militarily to this week's assassination of Hamas' top political leader in Tehran that Iran has blamed on Israel.
Austin also ordered the deployment of an additional fighter squadron to the Middle East "reinforcing our defensive air support capability," the statement said.
"The Department is also taking steps to increase our readiness to deploy additional land-based ballistic missile defense," it continued.
An F/A-18 Hornet launches from the aircraft carrier USS Abraham Lincoln (CVN 72), on Oct. 14, 2010.
Currently deployed to the western Pacific, it's unclear when the Lincoln would arrive in the Middle East to replace the Roosevelt, which is currently in the Gulf of Oman.

title: Mourners bury Hamas chief Haniyeh in Qatar as escalation looms over Middle East
message:
“Let Friday be a day of rage to denounce the assassination,” said Izzat al-Risheq, a senior Hamas official.
Khaled Kaddoumi, Hamas’ representative in Iran, was staying on a lower floor.
Mr Kaddoumi saw Mr Haniyeh face down, on the floor.
Mr Kaddoumi said Mr Haniyeh had stayed in the same guesthouse in May when he attended the funeral of Iranian president Ebrahim Raisi, killed in a plane crash.
Mr Haniyeh’s killing was another blow to the Hamas leadership.

title: Israelis Brace for Potential Attack by Iran
message:
Israelis braced for a potential attack by Iran as they headed into the weekend, amid threats by Iranian leaders to retaliate against Israel for a strike that killed Hamas political chief Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran earlier this week.
Rumors flew of potential Iranian plans — including a missile strike several times larger than the 300 projectiles launched at Israel in April, almost all of which were intercepted.
… The report indicates that there is an emotional and psychological impact in targeting Israel on the holy day of mourning.
The report claimed that Jewish Israelis may feel particularly vulnerable on this day – adding an additional layer of psychological torment.
The State of Israel itself is sometimes referred to by Jews as the “Third Temple,” an association that Iran is likely exploiting as a form of psychological warfare.

title: Mourners bury Hamas chief Haniyeh in Qatar as escalation looms over Middle East
message:
‘Let Friday be a day of rage to denounce the assassination,’ said Izzat al-Risheq, a senior Hamas official.
“Let Friday be a day of rage to denounce the assassination,” said Izzat al-Risheq, a senior Hamas official.
Mr Kaddoumi saw Mr Haniyeh face down, on the floor.
Mr Kaddoumi said Mr Haniyeh had stayed in the same guesthouse in May when he attended the funeral of Iranian president Ebrahim Raisi, killed in a plane crash.
Mr Haniyeh’s killing was another blow to the Hamas leadership.

title: Slain Hamas leader Haniyeh buried in Qatar amid vows of revenge against Israel
message:
Hamas and Iran have both accused Israel of carrying out the assassination and have pledged to retaliate against their foe.
Mourners at the ceremony included Khaled Meshaal, who is tipped to be the new Hamas leader.
Other senior Hamas officials and Qatar's Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad al-Thani also attended.
Widow mournsHaniyeh was the face of Hamas' international diplomacy as an Israeli offensive destroyed Gaza.
Israel has announced that an air strike it mounted last month assassinated Hamas military leader Mohammed Deif in Gaza.

title: US deploys jets and warships as Iran threatens Israel
message:
The United States will deploy additional warships and fighter jets to the Middle East to help defend Israel from possible attacks by Iran and its proxies, the Pentagon said.
Iran and its proxy in Gaza blamed the attack on Israel, which has not commented.
The US military had also intensified deployments before 13 April, when Iran launched an attack on Israel with drones and missiles.
Israel has not commented directly on the strike which killed Haniyeh.
Israel responded with an ongoing military operation in Gaza that has killed almost 40,000 people, according to the Hamas-run health ministry.

title: US military sending reinforcement to the Middle East
message:
U.S. warships and fighter jets are headed to the Middle East and nearby areas to bolster American defenses in support of Israel, as both countries brace for a possible military strike by Iran.
The U.S. moves include sending the USS Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier strike group to the Middle East, along with naval cruisers and destroyers capable of shooting down ballistic missiles.
Besides the additional ships and warplanes headed to the Middle East, the Pentagon has a U.S. Marine Corps amphibious ready group with some 4,000 troops in the region.
The USS Theodore Roosevelt carrier strike group is also in the Middle East but is expected to leave once the USS Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier strike group arrives.
This past April, the U.S. moved naval destroyers and other military assets into the region while coordinating with Britain, Jordan, Saudi Arabia and other allies in the Middle East to thwart a massive drone and missile barrage by Iran.

title: US sending warships , fighter squadron to Middle East as region braces for Iranian retaliation
message:
Iran has vowed to attack Israel for the assassination of Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran.
On August 2, hundreds of people gathered at a mosque in Qatar for the funeral of a Hamas leader.
Mourners included Khaled Meshaal, who is tipped as a possible successor to be the new Hamas leader, reported The Times of Israel.
Israel, which is at war with Hamas in the Gaza Strip, has neither acknowledged nor denied killing Haniyeh.
Earlier on Wednesday, he also ordered Iran to strike Israel directly, in retaliation for the killing of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran, the New York Times reported.

title: Mourners bury Hamas chief Haniyeh in Qatar as escalation looms over Middle East
message:
“Let Friday be a day of rage to denounce the assassination,” said Izzat al-Risheq, a senior Hamas official.
Khaled Kaddoumi, Hamas’ representative in Iran, was staying on a lower floor.
Mr Kaddoumi saw Mr Haniyeh face down, on the floor.
Mr Kaddoumi said Mr Haniyeh had stayed in the same guesthouse in May when he attended the funeral of Iranian president Ebrahim Raisi, killed in a plane crash.
Mr Haniyeh’s killing was another blow to the Hamas leadership.

title: Austin to send fighter jets , keep carrier group in Middle East for Israel defense
message:
Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin has ordered a fighter jet squadron, Navy ships and air defenses to the Middle East amid heightened regional tensions due to Israeli attacks in Iran and Lebanon.
“The Department of Defense continues to take steps to mitigate the possibility of regional escalation by Iran or Iran’s partners and proxies,” deputy Pentagon press secretary Sabrina Singh said in a statement Friday.
Israel has not claimed responsibility for Haniyeh’s death, but hours after the attack became public, Netanyahu gave defiant remarks, saying Israel is achieving its goals.
Israel did claim responsibility for a Tuesday strike in Beirut that killed a top Hezbollah commander.
For the latest news, weather, sports, and streaming video, head to The Hill.

title: US Sends More Warships Able to Down Ballistic Missiles to Counter Iran
message:
Focused on checking Iran and its proxies, it is deploying additional warships and fighter jets.
Israel is bracing for potential retaliation from Iran and its proxies over high-profile killings.
Go to newsletter preferences Thanks for signing up!
download the app Email address Sign up By clicking “Sign Up”, you accept our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy .
AdvertisementThe US is deploying additional warships able to shoot down ballistic missiles to the Middle East and nearby waters, a Pentagon spokesperson said Friday, as the region braces for a potential attack on Israel by Iran and its proxies.

title: US sending aircraft carrier , warships and fighter squadron to Middle East as region braces for Iranian retaliation
message:
By Oren Liebermann, CNN(CNN) — The US is sending a carrier strike group, a fighter squadron and additional warships to the Middle East as the region braces for an Iranian retaliation to the killing of a senior Hamas leader in Tehran earlier this week.
In addition, destroyers and cruisers capable of ballistic missile defense will also be sent to the Middle East and the Mediterranean Sea.
Austin also ordered the deployment of a fighter squadron to the region, Singh said.
Iran has vowed to attack Israel for the assassination of Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran.
US officials said the anticipated Iranian attack could occur in the coming days, and the US is closely watching the region for any indications of how it might play out.

“Let Friday be a day of rage to denounce the assassination,” said Izzat al-Risheq, a senior Hamas official.

title: Editorial : Hopes of a ceasefire fade as all - out war in Middle East looms
message:
Crowds follow the truck carrying the coffins of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh and his bodyguard in Tehran.
Haniyeh’s shock assassination has heightened concerns that the ­Middle East will be pushed over the edge.
His killing in Tehran, and the strike against senior Hezbollah commander Fouad Shukur in Beirut, may have scuppered attempts to defuse the Middle East powder keg.
An end to the fighting, the release of hostages and a long-term plan for peace and security in the Middle East are critical for global stability.
Should the Middle East powder keg explode, that terrible wave of bloodshed could become a near unstoppable tide.

Mr Kaddoumi said Mr Haniyeh had stayed in the same guesthouse in May when he attended the funeral of Iranian president Ebrahim Raisi, killed in a plane crash.
Mr Haniyeh’s killing was another blow to the Hamas leadership.

message:

title: US to bolster military presence in the Middle East amid threats from Iran
message:
Additionally, it said, “Secretary Austin has ordered additional ballistic missile defense-capable cruisers and destroyers to the US European Command and U.S. Central Command regions.
The statement came after Singh had told reporters that Austin has informed Israel about current and future changes to US forces in the Middle East, amid threats from Iran and Hamas and Hezbollah.
The comments followed the conversation between Austin and Defense Minister Yoav Gallant.
CNN further reported that President Joe Biden is weighing more US defenses in the Middle East as the US prepares for the Iranian retaliation against Israel.
(Israel National News' North American desk is keeping you updated until the start of Shabbat in New York.

title: Guam slated to homeport its first Virginia - class fast - attack submarine
message:
The Virginia-class fast-attack submarine USS Minnesota transits Pearl Harbor, Hawaii, on June 20, 2024, as it begins sea trials after undergoing a two-year maintenance period.
Rick Moore, a spokesperson for U.S. Pacific Fleet Submarine Force, said by email Friday.
The U.S. territory is home to Andersen Air Force Base, Naval Base Guam and Camp Blaz, a massive Marine Corps base still under construction.
The nuclear-powered Virginia-class subs will eventually replace the Navy’s aging fleet of Cold War-era Los Angeles-class vessels.
Guam was homeport to five Los Angeles-class submarines for most of 2022, a group that included USS Annapolis, USS Jefferson City, USS Asheville, USS Springfield and USS Key West.

title: James K . Walker Jr . Memorial included in Willoughby Union High School redevelopment
message:
In light of the Willoughby Union High School restoration project, the James K. Walker Jr. Memorial on the former school’s property will be reinstalled as part of the redevelopment.
The memorial will be put in safekeeping during construction, according to Dru Siley, vice president of development with Liberty Development.
With the property now owned by Liberty Development, the former school building is to be renovated into 40 market rate apartments.
Located in Wes Point Park in Downtown Willoughby, the project is also to include the construction of 19 for-sale townhomes flanking the building.
In World War II, Walker was in combat in the Army’s tank division in the European theater in France and Germany.

title: Dozens of babies diagnosed with new condition linked to fentanyl that causes deformed heads , conjoined toes and clubbed fingers
message:
Known as fetal fentanyl syndrome, the disorder causes multiple physical and brain defects, including conjoined fingers and toes and deformed heads.
Makes one NOSTALGIC for Fetal Alcohol Syndrome babies - many of which I rocked to sleep at our local hospital back in the day.

title: Venom War # 1 - Comic Book Preview
message:
Marvel Comics releases Venom War #1 on Wednesday, and you can check out the official preview of the issue below…LAST VENOM STANDING!
Now both Brocks are going head-to-head, determined to be the one, true Venom!
Father versus son in a showdown of showdowns that threatens to tear the world asunder!
From heavyweight talent champions Al Ewing and Iban Coello comes a Battle for the ‘Biote like you’ve never seen!
Venom War #1 goes on sale on August 7th, priced $5.99.

title: Army long - range tiltrotor aircraft moves to next development phase
message:
The U.S. Army’s future long-range aircraft is moving out of technology development and into the critical engineering and manufacturing development phase, the service announced Friday.
The service will now be able to issue a contract option to Bell as it enters the engineering and manufacturing development phase, which, combined with the low-rate production phases, could be worth roughly $7 billion.
Reaching the engineering and manufacturing development phase is “an important step for FLRAA and demonstrates the Army’s commitment to our highest aviation modernization priority,” Doug Bush, the Army acquisition executive, said in the statement.
The first aircraft in this phase is expected to fly in 2026, with low-rate initial production slated to begin in 2028.
The FLRAA program has set the standard for digital engineering from the beginning and has allowed for more rapid technology development and design.

title: Drones hit warehouses , fuel tanks in Rostov Oblast , official says
message:
Drones hit warehouses, fuel tanks in Rostov Oblast, official saysAn overnight drone strike caused damage to targets in Russia's Rostov and Oryol oblasts on Aug. 3, according to the governors of the respective regions and local Telegram news channels.
Residents in Rostov Oblast reported hearing explosions in Rostov-on-Don, Bataysk, and Morozovsk.
Fuel tanks reportedly caught fire in the region's Kamensky district.
"As a result of a massive UAV attack, a number of storage facilities in the Kamensky and Morozovsky districts were damaged," Rostov Oblast Governor Vasily Golubev said.
Ukrainian forces targeted the Morozovsk airfield with at least 70 drones in a mass attack on June 13.

title: Heroes & villains - Newspaper
message:
The New York Times has reported that thousands of foreign volunteers are lining up to fight alongside the Ukrainians and its correspondent was embedded with some of them.
Literary masterpieces like The Old Man and the Sea and For Whom the Bell Tolls are Ernest Hemingway’s prime claim to fame.
However, his sojourns during World War I and the Spanish Civil War are definitely a big part of ‘Papa’ Hemingway’s allure.
Support for Hamas and the Muslim Brotherhood comes under criticism as many governments proscribe them, but what if volunteers from various countries line up to fight alongside the Palestinians?
In our local languages, the word ‘strip’ is translated as patti, meaning both a narrow land mass and a bandage.

title: On the precipice of martial law ? * WorldNetDaily * by Joseph Farah
message:
The Department of Defense has been conditioning troops and commanders to do just that, to misuse their power, for many years.
The Posse Comitatus Act provides a broad proscription against the use of soldiers in domestic law enforcement.
But Congress and the executive branch have quietly chipped away at the law with exceptions seldom noticed by the fake media.
Indeed, we are living in far more dangerous times – times of open lawfare, fake news, assassination attempts, deeply divided government and, on the global scene, the brink of World War III.
Is martial law next?

title: Pakistan Claims PAF Pilots Training on Chinese J - 31 Stealth Fighter – Indian Defence Research Wing
message:
Pakistan Claims PAF Pilots Training on Chinese J-31 Stealth Fighter| BySOURCE: AFIPakistan’s national news channel, BOL NEWS, has made a significant claim, asserting that Pakistan Air Force (PAF) pilots have commenced training on the Chinese J-31 stealth fighter aircraft within China.
The acquisition of the J-31, if confirmed, would mark a substantial enhancement of Pakistan’s aerial capabilities.
Known for its stealth technology and advanced avionics, the J-31 is considered a formidable asset in modern warfare.
The potential induction of the J-31 into the PAF has far-reaching implications for the regional balance of power.
Official confirmation from both Pakistan and China is awaited to provide clarity on the matter.

title: The complete history of PlayStation Star Wars games
message:
Now is the ideal time to trace the history of Star Wars games on PlayStation, as Ubisoft Massive’s open world video game Star Wars Outlaws is grabbing headlines.
PlayStation Star Wars games: VR entriesGetting up close and personal with super-cool Star Wars tech is a plus in Vader Immortal.
PlayStation Star Wars games: expanded universeThe Doom-like Dark Forces shoves Star Wars weapons in your hands and asks you to get blasting.
PlayStation Star Wars games: online shootersEA DICE’s Battlefront reboot remains one of the most detailed renditions of the Star Wars galaxy in a videogame.
PlayStation Star Wars games: the rebelsFallen Order has brilliant set-pieces that often play with some of your favourite Star Wars toys.

title: Deadline
message:
Rule of Two Walls will premiere on SVOD platforms on November 12.
Cinematography is by Volodymyr Ivanov and David Gutnik.
Fellow EPs include Natalia Libet, Lance Acord, Jason Weinberg, Brett Etre, Jackie Bisbee, Michelle Booso, and Gil Elbaz.
Monument ReleasingMonument Releasing “endeavors to bring the best in undistributed cinema from the festival circuit to the theatrical, festival, VOD, DVD, and digital markets,” the company notes.
“Monument has three lines of focus: Festival Titles, American Indies, and Documentaries.

title: Humanitarians Call For Greater Support For Sudan Following Famine Declaration
message:
“To stop a large-scale famine from taking hold, donors must urgently scale up their support while using means to push for opening up of humanitarian access,”saidClementine Nkweta-Salami, the UN Humanitarian Coordinator for Sudan.
They highlighted that Sudan is facing the worst levels of food security in its history.
This includes more than 8.5 million who are facing emergency levels of hunger and more than 755,000 people suffering catastrophic conditions.
In response, humanitarians have been ramping up operations in recent months, but the needs are immense, Ms. Nkewata-Salami said.
Now we have the tragic confirmation that there is famine in Sudan's North Darfur region,”saidMamadou Dian Balde, the UN agency's regional refugee coordinator for the Sudan situation.

title: Canadian warship transits through the Taiwan Strait in provocation against China
message:
A Canadian warship sailed through the Taiwan Strait on Wednesday in a military provocation against the Chinese government that was carried out in close coordination with the Biden administration in the United States.
Canada’s trade union and New Democratic Party (NDP)-supported, Justin Trudeau-led Liberal government announced $2.3 billion in new spending in 2022 to develop Canada’s military presence across the Indo-Pacific.
The Taiwan Strait provocation follows shortly on the heels of a visit to Beijing by Foreign Minister Mélanie Joly, the first by Canada’s top diplomat to China in seven years.
Under the Canadian Armed Forces’ Operation Horizon, Canadian imperialism is establishing its own independent foothold and increasing its military presence in the Indo-Pacific.
Under Operation Neon, Canada’s military rotates warships and CP-140 Aurora surveillance planes to the region to enforce the trade blockade against North Korea.

title: Humanitarians call for greater support for Sudan following famine declaration
message:
“To stop a large-scale famine from taking hold, donors must urgently scale up their financial support while using diplomatic means to push for opening up of humanitarian access,” said Clementine Nkweta-Salami, the UN Humanitarian Coordinator for Sudan.
They highlighted that Sudan is facing the worst levels of food security in its history.
This includes more than 8.5 million who are facing emergency levels of hunger and more than 755,000 people suffering catastrophic conditions.
In response, humanitarians have been ramping up operations in recent months, but the needs are immense, Ms. Nkewata-Salami said.
Silence the guns“But to do this, we need the guns to be silenced to enable humanitarians to reach the people in need,” she said.

title: Still alive  - graduate Asmaa texts to BBC from Gaza ruins
message:
For six years the BBC’s Paul Adams has been in contact with a young graduate in Gaza.
Her text messages give a unique insight into the terrors and small triumphs she has experienced during the current conflict, and her fears for the future.
It is 19 March 2024 and after several weeks of silence, Asmaa Tayeh has reappeared on WhatsApp.
Long disappearances, punctuated by flurries of text messages, as the 28-year-old emerges, briefly, amid the nightmare of Gaza’s longest war.
Far away in London, my phone pings as the messages tumble in.

title: Irish troops prepare to take part in latest EU Battle Group
message:
Preparations are advancing for Irish troops to take part in major exercises in Germany and Hungary as part of the latest EU Battle Group (EUBG).
Around 180 Irish troops will take part in the multinational force which will be around 2,000-strong and led for the next 12 months by the Germans.
Take-up for the Irish positions on the battle group was initially slow, but almost 90% of them are now filled.
The Irish troops who have signed up for the battle group will have to remain on standby for all of next year in case the force is called into action.
The battle group became operational in 2007 following its creation by the EU's Common Security and Defence Policy (CSDP), which was ratified by the European Council.

title: Fear & Hunger dev seems to have some radical ideas in store for third entry
message:
Happy Paintings, the developer behind the amazing RPG Maker titles Fear & Hunger and Fear & Hunger 2: Termina, has recently spoken about the third game in the series and its possible directions.
Recommended VideosOn Twitter, Happy Paintings recently posted a few of their thoughts on what Fear & Hunger 3 might ultimately be.
The developer also goes on to make an incredibly bold statement about what Fear & Hunger 3 might do to the fan base.
The first Fear & Hunger is very much a dungeon crawler.
No one can predict where the third Fear & Hunger game will go.

title: Defense Secretary Austin Revokes Plea Deal With Accused 9 / 11 Mastermind , Accomplices
message:
Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin revoked a plea deal made earlier this week that would have spared the accused mastermind of the 9/11 terrorist attacks and his two alleged accomplices the death penalty.
The revoking of the plea deal effectively puts the death penalty back in place.
The facility was set up in 2002 by then-President George W. Bush to house foreign terrorist suspects following the 9/11 attacks.
The OMC said on July 31 that the specific terms of the plea deal were not currently publicly available.
When the Pentagon first announced the plea deal, some family members of the people who were killed in the 9/11 attacks reacted with anger.

title: 2018 Nevada Day Parade Entries and Divisions Line Up Locations
message:
Following are all of the entries for the 2018 Nevada Day Parade, to take place on Saturday, Oct. 27 starting at 10 a.m.
The parade starts at North Carson and William streets, and ends at South Carson and Stewart streets.
There are 215 entries in this year's parade.

title: Illinois Democrats , the Pritzker dynasty and the imperialist plunder of Ukraine
message:
Pritzker was appointed last September by President Joe Biden to act as the US Special Representative for Ukraine’s Economic Recovery.
War was good for American capitalism, and for capitalism in Ukraine as well:“Some of the best-loved supporters of Ukraine are American defense companies.
Referring to economic and political “reforms” Ukraine committed to last year, Pritzker said, “Kiev must keep this momentum going.
Indeed, this church is also the site of UCCA celebrations of the UPA and OUN in World War II.
It seems to me that no country in modern history since World War II, and maybe even in World War II, has suffered such losses.

title: The Challenge announces Battle of the Eras podcast hosts and fans react to decision
message:
With The Challenge set to return on MTV with Battle of the Eras, the official podcast will also return to provide coverage.
Fans react to The Challenge Season 40 podcast hostsFans are reacting to news about which hosts would be at the helm for the Battle of the Eras podcast episodes, and many seemed to favor Devyn and Da’Vonne returning as hosts.
Other options exist besides MTV’s Official Challenge Podcast, although not all are free.
There’s also Wes Bergman’s weekly podcast and the newer Zach Nichols Podcast, where fans can hear insight, tea, and cast interviews as The Challenge: Battle of the Eras season unfolds on MTV.
The Challenge: Battle of the Eras premieres Wednesday, August 14 at 8/7c on MTV.

title: The war is not finished : Ukrainians urge more support
message: "That should tell us something about the future of this war that, even when things are at the worst the Russians can't defeat the Ukrainians, so I think we should be a little bit more optimistic about their prospects."

title: Bauernfeind assumes role as 22nd Academy superintendent > Air Force Reserve Command > News
message:
U.S. Air Force Academy cadets, faculty and staff welcomed their 22nd superintendent, Lt. Gen. Tony Bauernfeind, during an assumption of command ceremony held here Aug. 2..
Bauernfeind will continue Clark’s goal of developing leaders of character, with an additional focus on creating warfighters in an era of Great Power Competition.
“It is an honor to lead the Air Force Academy with its rich history and legacy of developing leaders.
The cadets Bauernfeind leads will earn a Bachelor of Science degree and commission as second lieutenants into the U.S. Air Force and U.S. Space Force.
“As a military academy, our priorities are the foundation of everything we will do,” Bauernfeind said.

title: What would a Kamala Harris presidency mean for religious freedom ?
message:
Does Vice President Kamala Harris support religious freedom for all?
“She represents a religious pluralism that ought to be amenable to religious freedom,” he said.
“I think it would be fair to say that many religious conservatives find Kamala Harris’ beliefs about religious freedom troubling,” he said.
Some religious people support Harris’ past work on religious freedom, including her sponsorship of the Do No Harm Act, the Rev.
“Many of us working in religious freedom space feel strongly about its value but don’t want religious freedom to be used to harm others,” the Rev.

title: Tinubu : Our policies will propel economy out of downturn
message:
President Bola Tinubu says his administration has implemented bold policies to propel Nigeria’s economy out of the downturn caused by multiple shocks in the global economy.
Tinubu spoke on Friday while declaring open the 2024 African Caucus meeting held at the Transcorp Hotel, Abuja.
“As a government, we have initiated bold economic reforms aimed at steering our economy away from the downturns caused by multiple shocks in the global economy,” he said.
“We need enhanced international tax cooperation to combat illicit financial flows and ensure that multinationals contribute fairly to our economies,” Tinubu said.
“We must also foster global economic cooperation to tackle shared challenges and leverage opportunities.

title: Resilience is kind of the core ...: Groups raising money to rebuild retreat as Alexander Mountain Fire continues to burn in Colorado
message:
The Heart-J Center is an organization operating in the backcountry as an extension of Sylvan Dale Ranch in the Loveland area.
And then it was sort of a wait and see what happens situation,” Heart-J Center Executive Director Laura Armstrong told 11 News of the center’s immediate response as they learned about the fire.
Their friends at the Combat Recovery Foundation worked to immediately assist as well, both physically and financially.
“Myself and several members of my staff and board went out to the location and physically helped them evacuate materials and personnel,” Combat Recovery Foundation Founder Marshall Spring said.
“It’s been a very difficult week to be the Heart-J Center, and so to have this kind of friendship and partnership from... from such great people is... it’s beyond words,” Armstrong said.

title: Shooting a Civil War era cannon
message:
Thursday morning, a dozen cyclists rode into Pea Ridge National Military Park for the 40th annual edition of the Remember the Removal Bike Ride.
The ride from Georgia to Tahlequah honors the thousands of people forced from their homes to march along the Trail of Tears, which passed through what is now Pea Ridge National Military Park.
Ozarks at Large's Kyle Kellams visited the scene.

title: Potential VP Pick Shapiro Under Fire for Anti - Palestinian Op - ed in 1993
message:
Josh Shapiro (D), who is considered a likely contender to be Vice President Kamala Harris’s running mate, is facing criticism from left-wing Democrats over a pro-Israel op-ed he wrote in 1993 in which he doubted a two-state solution.
“They do not have the capabilities to establish their own homeland and make it successful even with the aid of Israel and the United States.
Anti-Israel staffers in the White House are reportedly furious over the potential selection of Shapiro as Harris’s running mate.
He is the author of “”The Agenda: What Trump Should Do in His First 100 Days,” available for pre-order on Amazon.
He is also the author of “The Trumpian Virtues: The Lessons and Legacy of Donald Trump’s Presidency,” now available on Audible.

title: Terrifying arsenal of firearms destined for Albanian gangs waging turf wars in Britain are seized in dramatic police operation - with haul including Glock pistol and Kalashnikov assault rifle
message:
A terrifying store of firearms destined for Albanian gangs waging turf wars in Britain have been seized by police in Tirana, Albania on Thursday.
Glock pistols and a Kalashnikov assault rifle were among the 25 weapons discovered during a police raid.
The firearms and hundreds of rounds of ammunition were reportedly meant to be shipped to Albanian gangs in the UK who are marking their territory in an ongoing turf war over drugs and prostitution in London.
Under the returns agreement, the UK has removed 26,000 people over the last year including nearly 6,000 Albanians, the Foreign Office said.
Also in May, Britain handed Albania £1.6million of cameras and drones in a bid to catch Channel people-smuggling gangs.
